summary: This document is an email chain from October 15, 2020, discussing the review and tagging of search results from electronic data in the case US v. Epstein. The correspondents are coordinating on search terms to identify junk versus responsive materials related to a search warrant.

events.title: Review of Search Results in US v. Epstein
events.description: Legal team members correspond to review and tag search results from electronic data in the Epstein case, specifically distinguishing junk from responsive documents.

keyFacts: Email chain discusses the review of search results from the US v. Epstein case database and a related search warrant (SW).
Specific search terms reviewed include 'Epstein — Junk Search Terms (From)' and 'Epstein — Junk Search Terms (Keywords)'.
A concern is raised that the keyword junk search caught non-junk, responsive documents, and also non-email documents.
The correspondence is procedural, focusing on data management and tagging for legal proceedings.
The document is part of a larger set, with a reference to file EFTA00066076.
